speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about the onset of the pain and when it started, was it sudden or did it gradually get worse over time?

speaker: Patient
text: The pain started a few days ago, to be honest, it just kind of came out of nowhere. It's been a dull ache, but it's been getting progressively worse, especially at night when I'm lying down.

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you describe the severity of the pain when it started - was it mild, moderate, or severe?

speaker: Patient
text: To be honest, when I first started noticing it, I'd say it was more of a mild ache, but it's definitely escalated to a moderate pain over the past few days, especially at night. It's not excruciating or anything, but it's definitely disrupting my sleep.

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about your daily activities when the pain started? Were you engaging in any strenuous activities or exercises that might have put extra pressure on your right flank area?

speaker: Patient

I've also been feeling a bit stressed lately, and I've been trying to manage my workload, so I'm not sure if that's contributing to the pain at all.

As for changes in my urination habits, I have noticed that I've been feeling the need to urinate more frequently, especially at night. It's not an overwhelming urge, but it's definitely a bit more frequent than usual.
